mobs.long_desc: A shadow warrior appears out of the mists to glare at you.
mobs.desc: Humanoid in form, but as insubstantial as mist, this figure has glowing red eyes and a snarling mouth. Little more can be made of its features. It wears the remains of a uniform of some kind, but this also is difficult to ascertain, as it seems to flicker in and out of sight.

mobs.long_desc: A skeleton warrior shambles towards you.
mobs.desc: A horror of sun bleached bones advances towards you with murderous intent. This undead creature has fragments of armour and clothing still upon it. With sickening realisation, you now know what became of Mystwatch's valiant warriors.

mobs.long_desc: A great shadowy hound glares at you hungrily.
mobs.desc: Almost as tall as a man, this unearthly creature eyes you with hunger in its eyes.  It stands on 6 legs, with skin as black as night, and as smooth as polished marble.  With a sinking heart, you notice that the saliva that drips from this foul beast's mouth makes a hissing sound as it hits the ground.
A huge figure seems to be standing here, but you are unsure as to what it is. Its form shifts often, now it looks vaguely humanoid, now a massive quadruped.

mobs.long_desc: A shadow warrior on a black horse glares at you.
mobs.desc: A shadowy cavalier sits astride his mount, both glaring at you with hate in their eyes. The horse expels great clouds of steam as it exhales, which is probably the cause of the horrible, pungent smell which accosts your nostrils.

mobs.long_desc: A vigilant warrior stands guard here.
mobs.desc: A black skinned entity stands watch here, vigilant, and fully intent on its task. Unlike the others, you finally see the true form of these creatures. Its skin seems to be like basalt, cold, black and hard. Long ivory claws projects menacingly from what you can only call its arms. A segmented tail lashes about as it stands waiting, watching, guarding.

mobs.long_desc: An officer stands here, studying some documents.
mobs.desc: The officer is busy studying a document of some sort. He looks rather angry at what he is reading.

mobs.long_desc: The General is standing here, discussing war-plans with his officers.
mobs.desc: Clearly this being is one of the walking dead, but he must have been quite a man in life. He is large and imposing, and though his flesh has begun to rot, and though he reeks of death, he still wears the vestiges of his onetime uniform proudly.

mobs.long_desc: The storm demon stands arrogantly here.
mobs.desc: A black-skinned creature stands before you. Lightning runs across his skin. You feel your hair stand up due to the static electricity. You realise that this creature must wield formidable power.

mobs.long_desc: The demon's minion is scurrying around here, running errands.
mobs.desc: The minion looks rather weak and scrawny. However you doubt it is harmless as it has an impressive array of teeth.

mobs.long_desc: A demon stands here, hidden in shadows.
mobs.desc: You cannot see its form clearly, but you can feel power emanating from the fell being.

mobs.long_desc: The Demon Lord sits on his throne.
mobs.desc: The Demon does not seem to notice you. Maybe he thinks you are beneath his notice. But seeing that he could probably kill you with his fingernail, his arrogance is justified.

mobs.long_desc: A charred skeleton almost escapes detection.
mobs.desc: A distrated and distant looking pair of eye sockets peer through you looking across the horizon in an uneasy patrol of fear....

mobs.long_desc: A charred warrior stands here smoking in his armor.
mobs.desc: A stout minion of the evil lord of this place nearly destroyed by the holy light in battle.  His demonic flesh smoulders as he seems to enjoy the pain.

mobs.long_desc: A well-clad minion of the order stands guard.
mobs.desc: Seared flesh still burning beneath the armor peer upward to the south as if recalling the sweet call of death in battle.

mobs.long_desc: An overbearing charred skeleton commands your allegiance.
mobs.desc: A black pile of bones barely visible to the eye at first stands erect swinging his menacing bony fist at you!

mobs.long_desc: A charred haggard warrior stands here pounding his fist against a sheet of metal.
mobs.desc: The smell of burnt flesh permiates the air as this creature, who once looked like a barbarian, wildly pounds a sheet of metal.  His dark eyes look lost in his madness...

mobs.long_desc: A tall man in black and crimson plate armor stands here, leering at you.
mobs.desc: This man is enormous, standing nearly 10 feet tall and looks to be a human!  His plate armor is daunting and nearly indistinguishable from the darkness of this fortress.  Crimson outlines of the armor could be ornate oulines, or...  His black hair matches that of the night and he laughs arrogantly at you as you approach.  He leans upon an equally enormous 2-handed sword which hums with mysterious energies. The Avatar of Zzur's eyes glow red periodically as he mentally searches for prey nearby...

objects.ground: A vague form of a sword is lying here.

extras.text: You cannot see the form of the sword clearly, it seems to waver between the physical and ethereal plane.  Though its appearance is insubstantial, the feel of the weapon is very much solid, well balanced, as well as sharp.

objects.ground: A crumpled cloak lies in a heap at your feet.

extras.text: The cloak seems to have a swirling pattern, the longer you look at it, the more difficult is it for you to see it clearly.  It almost seems to blend into the surroundings.

objects.ground: A great, jet black axe lies on the ground here.

extras.text: The huge half-moon head of the axe is as black as night, and seems to swallow all the light that falls upon it.  Blue sparks continuously dance upon its edge.

objects.ground: A black lance is carelessly left here.

extras.text: The lance is an impressive weapon, made of a strange dark coloured wood, and with a silvery leaf-shaped head.  As you run your fingers across its surface, you notice that it leaves you with a strange, tingling sensation and a moment of disorientation.

objects.ground: A thin rapier lies abandoned on the ground.

extras.text: This rapier is made of a very light but strong metal.  You experience a tingling sensation as you hold it.  Its hilt is inlaid in gold and has curious circular designs engraved on it.

objects.ground: A crystal orb floats around you.

extras.text: The orb is totally weightless and possesses a very bright glow.  Gazing into its crystalline depths, there seems to be insubstantial forms floating within it.  Before you can decide what lies within, you are forced to look away, lest its light blinds you.

objects.ground: A heavy greatsword in a leather scabbard rests against the wall.

extras.text: This is a heavy, 7 feet long sword made of a dark metal.  The hilt is shaped in the form of an eagle's head, and a ruby is clasped between its beak.

objects.ground: A large, rusty halberd lies off to the side.

extras.text: A large axe head is firmly attached to one end of a 7 feet long pole. It appears to be a rather old version of this weapon, as the axe blade lacks the spike with which to thrust at an opponent.

objects.ground: A large black shield is almost hidden by debris.

extras.text: This is the legendary Stormshield, once used by the Lords of Mystwatch. Resembling a large heater shield, there is a heraldic design emblazoned upon it.  It is said that this shield was forged by the Gods themselves in the beginning of the world.
An argent hawk outstretched, upon an azure field.

objects.ground: A heavy strongbox sits in the corner.

extras.text: The strongbox appears to be made of wood, with sheets of iron encasing and reinforcing it. It looks like something you'd use to keep your valuable.

objects.ground: A pile of coins.

extras.text: Your mouth begins to water as you mentally count the loot.

objects.ground: A small leather bag lies on the ground.

extras.text: The bag is made of well cured leather, with a leather thong around its opening, allowing you to close it like a purse. Its just the right size to hang on your belt.

objects.ground: A handful of red stones lies on the ground.

extras.text: The rubies have a fiery red colour, as if there are raging fires within them. They'll make nice ornaments to adorn you.

objects.ground: A storage barrel is left in a corner.

extras.text: This barrel looks very solid. The lid has been sealed with wax and it's still intact.

objects.ground: There is a piece of cheese here.

extras.text: From your knowledge of Mystwatch's history, you surmise that this piece of cheese is probably well aged. There is no signs of decay on it, and its texture and smell entices your palate.

objects.ground: A dusty weapons rack is discarded in a corner.

extras.text: The rack is solidly built, with proper receptacles to hold the various weapons of the soldiers. Now, a thick layer of dust coats it.

objects.ground: A spear rests against the wall.

extras.text: Approximately 6 feet long and rather light, this spear would make an excellent weapon for a beginner. Strips of cloth are wound around the pole, giving you a firm grip.

objects.ground: An amber key lies here.

extras.text: The key appears to be made of amber. As you look closely, there seems to be air bubbles trapped within it.

objects.ground: A turquoise key lies here.

extras.text: The turquoise green colour of this key is pleasing to your eye.

objects.ground: A glowing key lies here.

extras.text: Some strange enchantment has imbued this key with a strange, ruddy glow.

objects.ground: A shard of bright emerald lies here.

extras.text: Apparently carved out of a piece of emerald, you wonder who was the artisan who made this object.

objects.ground: A small gold key is almost hidden by the dirt.

extras.text: The key is made of solid gold, but being less than half an inch long, it is rather easy to miss.

objects.ground: An ethereal ball rests on a post.

extras.text: A long post with a shadowy ball on the end, this ethereal mace possesses some powers of external planes.  This mace has four large spikes on each cardinal side of the ball atop the post.  The mace is quite heavy and has a rather ornate handle to grab.

objects.ground: A wide black band of metallic links is piled up here.

extras.text: This girdle is little more than a thick shadow.  It is a black band of tightly interwoven, metalic links which are bound together to form the girdle.  Each link is made of an incoporeal substance, shrouded within a tangible frame.

objects.ground: A small circlet of dark metal lies here.

extras.text: This is a simple little ring, it is black with flecks of grey shimmering in and out of being.  For the most part, the ring does not exist in any coporeal form, but tends to wander back and forth to its ethereal state.

objects.ground: A pair of black metal bands lies here.

extras.text: These bracers look as though they are regular metal which has been extracted from a long and coolly burning fire.  They are scarcely more than bands of metal any longer, but are solid despite the long, slow burn.

objects.ground: A black set of chain linked gauntlets lies here.

extras.text: These gauntlets have smoldered in the heat of a black flame for many ages, as in apparent by the perpetual signs of soot lingering in all of the crevices. They are solid and well fashioned, yet appear to have degraded in the flames over the years.

triggers.name: Mystwatch_cycle_semantics_1
triggers.commands: mecho A silhouette moves across the shadows. hide

triggers.name: general_start_myst
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %object.vnum% == 3026 * advance the quest set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step general msend %person% &7&bYou have delivered the totem to the General!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done set myst_gen_active 1 global myst_gen_active wait 1 mpurge totem mecho %self.name% starts to examine the totem which begins to glow and hum. wait 2 say So, that fool Magistrate down in the forest town is such a coward that he must send the likes of YOU to do his bidding. wait 2 say Well... I shall have to make examples of you all now... cackle wait 1 kill %actor.name% else wait 1 say Thank you, thank you very much. endif endif

triggers.name: myst_general_death
triggers.commands: * Hopefully this can reference a global setting from * another trigger or lack there of. This is to check * to make sure the quest has been properly initiated if %myst_gen_active% == 1 * advance the quest for everyone involved set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step skeleton msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done * Does next mob in spawn cycle already exist? If %get.mob_count[16015]% < 1 * Generate random room number to spawn charred in. * Thanks to the evil Pergus for inspiring me to be * more evil. set rnd_range %random.78% eval rnd_room %rnd_range% + 15999 mat 16095 mload mob 16015 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 75 mat 16095 mforce charred mload obj 16030 mat 16095 mteleport charred %rnd_room% else mat 16095 mteleport charred %rnd_room% endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just in case. mat 16095 mpurge mecho %self.name% rasps, 'You think you have won but my charred minions will finish you!' mecho %self.name% emits a terrible wail as his spirit is banished from this realm. endif endif

triggers.name: charred_skeleton_death
triggers.commands: * load charred warrior then maybe equip set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step warrior msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done If %get.mob_count[16016]% < 1 set rnd_range %random.78% eval rnd_room %rnd_range% + 15999 mat 16095 mload mob 16016 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 75 mat 16095 mforce warrior mload obj 16031 mat 16095 mforce warrior wear all mat 16095 mteleport warrior %rnd_room% else mat 16095 mteleport warrior %rnd_room% endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just incase. mat 16095 mpurge endif

triggers.name: charred_warrior_death
triggers.commands: set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step sentry msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done * load charred sentry then maybe equip If %get.mob_count[16017]% < 1 set rnd_range %random.78% eval rnd_room %rnd_range% + 15999 mat 16095 mload mob 16017 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 75 mat 16095 mforce sentry mload obj 16032 mat 16095 mforce sentry wear all mat 16095 mteleport sentry %rnd_room% else mat 16095 mteleport sentry %rnd_room% endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just incase. mat 16095 mpurge endif

triggers.name: charred_sentry_death
triggers.commands: set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step warlord msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done * load charred warlord and maybe equip If %get.mob_count[16018]% < 1 set rnd_range %random.78% eval rnd_room %rnd_range% + 15999 mat 16095 mload mob 16018 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 75 mat 16095 mforce warlord mload obj 16033 mat 16095 mforce warlord wear all mat 16095 mteleport warlord %rnd_room% else mat 16095 mteleport warlord %rnd_room% endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just incase. mat 16095 mpurge endif

triggers.name: charred_warlord_death
triggers.commands: set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step blacksmith msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done * load charred Blacksmith and maybe equip If %get.mob_count[16019]% < 1 mat 16095 mload mob 16019 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 75 mat 16095 mforce blacksmith mload obj 16034 mat 16095 mforce blacksmith wear all mat 16095 mteleport blacksmith 16053 else mat 16095 mteleport blacksmith 16053 endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just incase. mat 16095 mpurge endif

triggers.name: charred_blacksmith_death
triggers.commands: set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step shadow msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %get.mob_count[16010]% < 1 * load shadow demon and equip keys * It would be nice to check to see if the keys * are already in the game and not load them. * There is a pending coding request for this. mat 16095 mload mob 16010 mat 16095 mforce demon mload obj 16020 mat 16095 mforce demon mload obj 16021 mat 16095 mteleport demon 16052 endif mecho %self.name% rasps, 'You think you have won, but the demons have taken notice of you now..' * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just incase. mat 16095 mpurge

triggers.name: shadow_demon_death
triggers.commands: If %get.mob_count[16008]% < 1 * load storm demon and maybe equip orb * but definitely load key mat 16095 mload mob 16008 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 33 mat 16095 mforce storm mload obj 16006 mat 16095 mforce storm mload obj 16022 mat 16095 mforce storm wear all mat 16095 mteleport storm 16076 else * The orb is required for Druids on the Moonwell quest and for Sorcerers on the Wizard Eye quest set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% > 0 || %person.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% > 0 mat 16095 mforce storm mload obj 16006 mat 16095 mforce storm wear all endif if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step storm msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mat 16095 mforce storm mload obj 16022 mat 16095 mteleport storm 16076 endif endif * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just in case. mat 16095 mpurge mecho A violent lightning storm continues outside...

triggers.name: storm_deamon_death
triggers.commands: set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step lord msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done If %get.mob_count[16011]% < 1 * load demon lord and maybe equip shield * but definitely load shard mat 16095 mload mob 16011 set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% <= 50 mat 16095 mforce lord mload obj 16009 mat 16095 mforce lord mload obj 16023 mat 16095 mforce lord wear all mat 16095 mteleport lord 16406 endif mat 16095 mforce lord mload obj 16023 mat 16095 mteleport lord 16406 mat 16095 m_run_room_trig 16050 endif

triggers.name: demon_lord_death
triggers.commands: * advance the quest set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[mystwatch_quest]% quest variable mystwatch_quest %person.name% step complete msend %person% &7&bYou have slain the Demon Lord of Mystwatch!&0 msend %person% &7&bGroup credit will not be given for returning the emerald shard to the Templar Magistrate.&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done

triggers.name: demon_lord_shout
triggers.commands: wzoneecho 160 The Demon Lord shouts 'Who DARES to disturb my realm?!'

rooms.name: Postern Gatehouse
rooms.description: This gatehouse is made of dark stone. Once the stones were fitted together tightly, but now age has pitted and worn out the mortar between them, and stones are cracked or missing here and there. The fortress itself rises up behind the gatehouse, stern and forbidding, and obviously abandoned. A road is visible to the north, leaving the fortress and gatehouse.

North.description: You see the beginning of the Northern Swamps Road.

rooms.name: The Southern Gatehouse
rooms.description: This long-ago abandoned building is much taller than it is wide, and the doors that once stood in its north and south walls have long ago either fallen off or were torn off.  The gatehouse is constructed of many bricks of dark stone, but the stones are starting to crack and turn to rubble.  Beyond the gatehouse is visible the ruins that was once its courtyard. The swamp lies to the south.

rooms.name: A Barren Courtyard
rooms.description: This wide expanse of ground lies between the southern gatehouse to the south, and the compound's main building, visible to the northwest a short distance away. Not even dead grass is visible in the bare dirt ground, but the area is far from empty; rubble from the walls and buildings, and rusted-out armor and swords, litter the ground.

rooms.name: Near the Main Fortress
rooms.description: This barren courtyard runs along the outside of the main building of the compound. The bare dirt is free of even dead grass, but is littered with rubble from the building and old, rusted weapons and shields. The large building rises to the northeast a short distance away. A metal staircase, rusted with time, ascends to the battlements.

rooms.name: Near the Main Fortress
rooms.description: This barren courtyard runs along the outside of the main building of the compound. The bare dirt is free of even dead grass, but is littered with rubble from the building and old, rusted weapons and shields. The large building rises to the northwest a short distance away. A metal staircase, rusted with time, ascends to the battlements.

rooms.name: Near the Main Fortress
rooms.description: This part of the castle grounds run right up against the outer wall of the main building of the compound. The ground is utterly barren, without even grass growing on it. The bare dirt is covered in dust and rubble, though, some of it misting over broken armor and shields. Bits of masonry and dark stone from the nearby compound walls lies here and there as well.

rooms.name: The Middle of the Courtyard
rooms.description: This is the middle of the large expanse of ground lying between the compound's main building and its outer walls. It is utterly barren, without even grass growing on it, but it is far from empty; various bits of rubble and old, rusted pieces of armor litter the ground. There are no skeletons visible, however. The entrance to the main building lies to the north -- a doorway with the door ripped away.

North.description: You see the door of the keep. It seems to have been blown off its hinges.

extras.text: As you peer into its depths, you notice that there are metal spikes jammed into the walls, something like a makeshift staircase. An aura of mystery and danger surrounds you...... You are unsure whether or not you should venture down. A trap maybe?

rooms.name: Near the Main Fortress
rooms.description: This is a bit of barren courtyard encircling the walls of the large fortress. The main building itself rises to the southwest not far away. Rubble and bits of rusted weapons and shields lie everywhere, and sometimes even some bones can be seen, almost buried in dirt.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This courtyard encircles the area between the fortress walls and the keep itself. The ground is barren, without even grass growing on it, but it is littered with rubble and rusted pieces of metal that were once weapons and shields. There are, however, no bones visible at all.

rooms.name: Stableyard
rooms.description: This abandoned structure is built right up against the main building of the compound. The circular expanse of ground is now barren, with nothing growing on it, not even grass. The roof of the structure has long since fallen in upon itself, but the entrance to the stables themselves is visible to the east, and another little structure to the west.

extras.text: The tracks look fresh, as if horses had just been stabled here. But as you look closer, you realise that no animal you know had made these tracks.
The stables looks run down and battered but you notice that there are fresh tracks leading out from the building.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This courtyard encircles the area between the fortress walls and the keep itself. The ground is barren, without even grass growing on it, but it is littered with rubble and rusted pieces of metal that were once weapons and shields. There are, however, no bones visible at all.

rooms.name: Tower Rampart
rooms.description: This part of the tower breaks free of the fog that covers the rest of the keep tower.  The Northern Swamps stretch out north as far as the eye can see, interrupted occasionally by hulking figures of structures built in the swamps. Tall hills are visible to the west, and far to the east is the sparkle of light on a large body of water.  Down is the fog-encased rampart.

Down.description: The Keep Tower is below, full of fog.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This is a barren patch of ground encircling the area between the fortress to the southwest and the fortress walls themselves. There is no vegetation growing, but the ground is littered with broken bits of masonry and rusted weapons and shields. The area looks like it was abandoned many years ago, for even the walls themselves appear to be in bad shape, with bricks cracking and eroding. A stableyard stands to the south.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This is a courtyard circling a large fortress made of dark stone.  The walls of the fortress encircle the main building, and a rusting metal staircase leads up onto the battlements of the walls.  The gatehouse is visible to the northeast.  The ground here is barren, without any vegetation growing, and is littered with rubble and bits of stone from the walls.  Though there are many pieces of rusted weapons laying around, there are no bones within sight.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This is the outer yard circling the large fortress rising nearby.  Its walls enclose a little courtyard between it and the gatehouse just to the north. The ground is barren, without even grass growing, and rusted weaponry and other rubble litter the ground.  There are, however, no bones anywhere within view.

rooms.name: The Castle Grounds
rooms.description: This is a small courtyard encircling the fortress to the southwest, between it and the tall walls surrounding the encampment. The ground is barren, with not even browned grass present. The area looks like it was abandoned many years ago; there are rusted pieces of armor and bits of rubble from the walls visible everywhere. A rusted metal staircase leads up to the battlements on the walls.

rooms.name: The Stables
rooms.description: The old, abandoned building has almost completely fallen in upon itself; the roof is riddled with many large, open sections where it partially collapsed. If there was hay here, it's long since decomposed. If there were animals here when the building decayed, their skeletons have long since disintegrated. A strange, musky scent permeates the air.

rooms.name: Tower
rooms.description: The inside of this tower is dark and dank.  Dark spots stain the floor, and rusted pieces of armour and weaponry litters the ground.  You peer out of one of the arrowslits, but you can't see much.  There is too much fog out there.

rooms.name: The Battlements
rooms.description: These wide parapets run along the top of the wall surrounding the keep. The masonry, once superb, is now sadly pitted and chipped by time. There are no signs of battle here, with neither weapons nor skeletons present. A rusting metal staircase leads down into the grounds of the keep.

extras.text: The masonry has been badly shattered, rubble lies everywhere. You have to tread carefully as not to trip on the loose rock.
The great catapults and scorpions lie in broken heaps.

rooms.name: Above the Gatehouse
rooms.description: You stand above the gatehouse of the keep.  The mechanism for raising the portcullis lies shattered here, as if it was crushed by a great force.  A dark shape lingers near the shattered device, a menacing presence perhaps?  Or a figment of your imagination?

extras.text: The mechanism has been shattered, as if a huge fist had struck it.

rooms.name: The Battlements
rooms.description: These wide parapets run along the top of the wall surrounding the keep. The masonry, once superb, is now sadly pitted and chipped by time. There are no signs of battle here, with neither weapons nor skeletons present. A rusting metal staircase leads down into the grounds of the keep.

extras.text: The masonry has been badly shattered, rubble lies everywhere. You have to tread carefully as not to trip on the loose rock.
The great catapults and scorpions lie in broken heaps.

rooms.name: Tower
rooms.description: The inside of this tower is dark and dank.  Dark spots stain the floor, and rusted pieces of armour and weaponry litters the ground.  You peer out of one of the arrowslits, but you can't see much.  There is too much fog out there.

rooms.name: The Battlements
rooms.description: These wide parapets run along the top of the wall surrounding the keep. The masonry, once superb, is now sadly pitted and chipped by time. There are no signs of battle here, with neither weapons nor skeletons present.

extras.text: The great siege engines which once defended this keep were reduced to shattered burnt out hulks.
The stonework has been shattered, and debris lies all over the ground. You have to walk carefully to avoid tripping over all this rubble. This mist only makes the conditions worse.

rooms.name: The Battlements
rooms.description: These wide parapets run along the top of the wall surrounding the keep. The masonry, once superb, is now sadly pitted and chipped by time. There are no signs of battle here, with neither weapons nor skeletons present.

There are no signs of battle here, with neither weapons nor skeletons present. A rusting metal staircase leads down into the grounds of the keep.

extras.text: The great siege engines which once defended this keep were reduced to shattered burnt out hulks.
The stonework has been shattered, and debris lies all over the ground. You have to walk carefully to avoid tripping over all this rubble. This mist only makes the conditions worse.

rooms.name: Tower
rooms.description: The inside of this tower is dark and dank.  Dark spots stain the floor, and rusted pieces of armour and weaponry litters the ground.  You peer out of one of the arrowslits, but you can't see much.  There is too much fog out there.

rooms.name: Tower battlements
rooms.description: The battlements are surprisingly free of fog.  You can see the rest of the land from here, but the castle below is hidden from view.  Upon the keep's tower, you notice a dark, mist enshrouded figure.  It seems to be the source of this fog as you notice that the fog is thickest there.

extras.text: It seems to be waving it's hands around in the fog. Sometimes, the fog suddenly lights up as if there is lightning in there, just like a storm cloud.

rooms.name: Tower storeroom
rooms.description: This seems to be the place where provisions and other spare supplies were kept.  There are still remains of large barrels and crates here.  Maybe there are still goodies that the conquerors had missed.

rooms.name: Tower battlements
rooms.description: The battlements are surprisingly free of fog.  You can see the rest of the land from here, but the castle below is hidden from view.  Upon the keep's tower, you notice a dark, mist enshrouded figure.  It seems to be the source of this fog as you notice that the fog is thickest there.

extras.text: It seems to be waving it's hands around in the fog. Sometimes, the fog suddenly lights up as if there is lightning in there, just like a storm cloud.

rooms.name: Tower storeroom
rooms.description: This seems to be the place where provisions and other spare supplies were kept.  There are still remains of large barrels and crates here.  Maybe there are still goodies that the conquerors had missed.

rooms.name: Tower battlements
rooms.description: The battlements are surprisingly free of fog.  You can see the rest of the land from here, but the castle below is hidden from view.  Upon the keep's tower, you notice a dark, mist enshrouded figure.  It seems to be the source of this fog as you notice that the fog is thickest there.

extras.text: It seems to be waving it's hands around in the fog. Sometimes, the fog suddenly lights up as if there is lightning in there, just like a storm cloud.

rooms.name: Tower storeroom
rooms.description: This seems to be the place where provisions and other spare supplies were kept.  There are still remains of large barrels and crates here.  Maybe there are still goodies that the conquerors had missed.

rooms.name: Tower battlements
rooms.description: The battlements are surprisingly free of fog.  You can see the rest of the land from here, but the castle below is hidden from view.  Upon the keep's tower, you notice a dark, mist enshrouded figure.  It seems to be the source of this fog as you notice that the fog is thickest there.

extras.text: It seems to be waving it's hands around in the fog. Sometimes, the fog suddenly lights up as if there is lightning in there, just like a storm cloud.

rooms.name: Tower storeroom
rooms.description: This seems to be the place where provisions and other spare supplies were kept.  There are still remains of large barrels and crates here.  Maybe there are still goodies that the conquerors had missed.

rooms.name: Guardroom
rooms.description: As usual, debris of all sorts litter this room.  You can see the signs of a great struggle here.  The remaining furniture has signs of being hacked up by swords and axes.

rooms.name: Keep Entrance
rooms.description: Torn tapestries hang on the walls, a sad testament of former glory.  The paintings that once adorned this hall are now faded and torn.  A pathway leads to the Great Hall to the north.  To the east you see what once was the guardhouse, and to the west you see the entrance to an armoury.  A staircase leads up to the Lord's living area.  There is some form of illumination here, but you can't see its source.

rooms.name: Armoury
rooms.description: The armoury looks like it had been looted a long time ago.  The weapon racks are all empty, not even an arrowhead remain.  There are pieces of wood littered all over the floor.  The conquerers must have been very destructive people. There is a training room to the north, and the main keep entrance is west.

rooms.name: The Lord's Private Bath
rooms.description: This must have been a very pleasant room once, but now, like the rest of the fortress, it is a scene of vengeance and destruction.  Shards of broken glass from a large mirror whose frame stands empty on one wall make it dangerous to be barefooted in this room, and the fine porcelin tub is missing several large chunks.  The Lord's bedroom is back to the east.

East.description: The Lord's bedroom is east through a small door.

rooms.name: Great Hall
rooms.description: You are in the Great Hall of this keep.  There are long wooden tables arranged neatly in rows here.  This was where the occupants of this castle had their meals with their Lord.  At the far end, you can see the great table of the Lord.

rooms.name: Training Room
rooms.description: This room is totally devoid of furniture.  In the middle of the room, a large crest of the Lord is engraved upon the floor.  A faded bronze plaque is placed just at the entrance of this room.

extras.text: A faded crest with an eagle rampart is painted onto the floor. You can see that the colours were once very bright but the passage of time had reduced their splendour.
The sign reads : TRAINING ROOM PLEASE COLLECT YOUR WEAPONS AT THE ARMOURY

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: You enter what used to be the kitchen of this keep.  Cooking implements which once hung on racks now litter the ground.  Shards of pottery can be found everywhere.  However, there are signs that the fireplace was quite recently used.  Warm embers still burn in it.  A trapdoor leads down into the cellar.

Down.description: A sturdy trapdoor leads down to the cellar.

extras.text: It looks like someone had just roasted some meat over the fire here. It smells rather pleasant, though, something about it unsettles you. Your eyes drifts off to look at the spit, and you recoil with horror. There are traces of clothing stuck onto it!

rooms.name: Great Hall
rooms.description: Your footstep rings out in the empty hall as you walk around it.  At the head of the room is the Lord's table, mounted on a raised platform.  Arrayed below are rows of wooden tables for his retainers to wine and dine.  Remnants of pennants and shields hang on the wall, a sad reminder of good days gone by. The great hall continues south and there is a guardroom north.

rooms.name: Smithy
rooms.description: This structure was once a large smithy, but now it has fallen into complete disrepair. The central forge is rusted and pockmarked, and the anvils and smith's tools lie scattered on the ground, their wooden handles gone, and their iron heads rusted through. In the far corner of the room lie two ancient skeletons, one fairly large, and one fairly small.

rooms.name: Cellar
rooms.description: You enter a dark cellar where the cooks had kept their food supplies.  The smell of garlic still permeates the air after all these years.  A large cupboard dominates the eastern wall of the cellar.  Wine casks lie shattered here, their contents spilled long ago.

East.description: There is a rather battered cupboard here. It was probably used to keep food.

Up.description: The trapdoor leads up into the kitchen.

extras.text: As you touch the cupboard, it swings out a little. You notice that there is a passageway behind the cupboard! This must lead somewhere.

rooms.name: Barracks
rooms.description: The remains of beds and cupboards litters the room.  Nothing of any value has been left behind here.  Whoever who looted this place surely was thorough.

rooms.name: Guardroom
rooms.description: This guardroom looks very well used.  There are still scuff marks of boots on the floor here.  A ladder leads up to the tower of the keep.

rooms.name: Chapel
rooms.description: There is an altar at the north end of the room but it has dark stains on it. It.  You realise that someone had desecreated this place with blood.  The icons that decorated this place lie shattered on the ground.  You see a door to the north.  That was probably the priest's quarters.

North.description: A simple wooden door blocks off entry to the north.

rooms.name: Barracks
rooms.description: The remains of beds and cupboards litters the room.  Nothing of any value has been left behind here.  Whoever who looted this place surely was thorough.

rooms.name: Armoury
rooms.description: This armoury held the weapons and armour of the elite guards of the Lord. Too bad their skill was not good enough to save their castle.  At least here, some of the racks are still intact.  Perhaps there are still weapons and armour among the debris.

rooms.name: Priest's Quarters
rooms.description: This room used to be the quarters of the clerics of this castle.  It looks like it was very sparsely furnished.  The furniture has been broken up and broken shards of ceramics litter the ground.

South.description: A simple wooden door blocks off entry to the south.

rooms.name: Guardroom
rooms.description: This guardroom is very well equipped.  There's plenty of supplies of all sorts in here.  Of course, this could be because it's still occupied.  The sounds of talking seems to be coming from a room to the north.  A large, oak door is to the north.

North.description: There is a door in that direction.

rooms.name: Stair Landing
rooms.description: As you climb the stairs, you hear sounds of people discussing nearby.  It seems to be coming from somewhere to the west.  There are doors to the east and west.  A short corridor leads to the north.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.description: Shelves line the walls but no books are kept there.  Pieces of parchment and paper litter the ground.  Looks like all the books here were taken away, and in a very hasty fashion.  A door leads north to the study.

rooms.name: War-room
rooms.description: Maps of all sorts adorn the walls here.  A large, round table sits in the middle of this room.  Maps and reports are strewn all over it.  The remains of half-eaten meals of unknown nature are on a tray near the door.

South.description: There is a door in that direction.

rooms.name: Corridor
rooms.description: The were once rooms which opened up to this corridor, but they have all been sealed up.  The only way you can go is back to the landing.  You wonder why they made this corridor lead into a dead end.

rooms.name: Study
rooms.description: This is a very spacious room and quite brightly lit.  Shelves line the walls but as in the library, there are no books.  You wonder why the books were taken away like that.  There is still some good furniture left behind.  A very comfortable armchair sits near a broken stained glass window.  There is a single human skeleton in this room, amidst a pile of unearthly bones.

extras.text: The skeleton appears to belong to a human knight, as it is still in its age tarnished armour. A broken longsword is gripped in its right hand, and in its left, the battered remains of a heater shield. All around it are the hacked off limbs and bodies of his opponent. It seems like the conquerers of this castle saw fit not the disturb the body of this valiant warrior.

The armour is of a very ancient design, at least 600 years old. There is a nasty gash in the breastplate, as if a sharp object had penetrated it. Other than that, there are no other signs of damage on it.
Inscribed into the hilt of the blade are the words, 'The rock of Dagmarck'
The shield bears a proud coat of arms, one which seems vaguely familiar to you.
On a field quartered, azure and sable.

rooms.name: Guardroom
rooms.description: This guardroom is very well equipped.  There's plenty of supplies of all sorts in here.  Of course, this could be because it's still occupied.  A large oak door is to the east.

East.description: A solid wooden door is there.

rooms.name: Treasury
rooms.description: This is the treasury of the keep.  You can see stacks of records and documents on shelves all around the room.  Bags of money are stacked in a corner.  There must be a strongbox of some sort somewhere around here.

West.description: There is a solid wooden door there.

rooms.name: Lord's Bedroom
rooms.description: A large bed dominates this room.  It looks very comfortable and warm, but as you come closer, you notice that the mattress is worm-eaten.  Cobwebs hang from the bed.  You notice that there is a skeleton of a man in the bed.

West.description: A small door leads to a bathroom.

extras.text: This looks the like skeleton of a man. He seems to have been killed in his sleep. The rotten remains of his clothing still hangs on the bones. It looks like velvet or silk. You realise that this was the late Lord of this castle.

rooms.name: Rampart
rooms.description: You can't see too well here.  The fog is extremely thick here.  The fog seems to be coming from somewhere on top of the tower.

rooms.name: Keep Tower
rooms.description: A ladder leads up to the ramparts of the inner bailey.  You feel your hair stand on ends here.  Fear perhaps?

rooms.name: Rampart
rooms.description: You can't see too well here.  The fog is extremely thick here.  The fog seems to be coming from somewhere on top of the tower.

rooms.name: Rampart
rooms.description: You can't see too well here.  The fog is extremely thick here.  The fog seems to be coming from somewhere on top of the tower.

rooms.name: Rampart
rooms.description: You can't see too well here.  The fog is extremely thick here.  The fog seems to be coming from somewhere on top of the tower.

Up.description: A tower rises out of the fog.

rooms.name: Rampart
rooms.description: You can't see too well here.  The fog is extremely thick here.  The fog seems to be coming from somewhere on top of the tower.

rooms.name: Tower Rampart
rooms.description: You can hardly see your hand in front of your face here, the fog is incredibly thick.  There is also a lot of static electricity here.  Your hair begins to stand on its ends.

rooms.name: Dead End
rooms.description: You come to the end of the passageway.  It seems to be a dead end.  On the ground you can see the skeletal remains of humans.  Upon closer examination, you notice teeth marks on their bones.  There must be a carnivorous creature around here.

rooms.name: Western Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel continues to the west.

rooms.name: Another T-Junction
rooms.description: This passageway comes to an end at a t-junction.  Tunnels lead to the east and west.

rooms.name: Eastern Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues on towards the east.

rooms.name: Eastern Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues on towards the east.

rooms.name: Murals Chamber
rooms.description: You enter a very brightly lit chamber.  There are paintings and murals all around the room.  A heavy, metal trapdoor is in the middle of the room.  There are words of unknown nature engraved upon it.

Down.description: The metal of the trapdoor seems to have a very slick gleam to it, something similar to wet blood. But as you run your fingers on it, it is dry.

rooms.name: Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel leads upwards and northward.  However, you have a feeling of foreboding and doom here, as if you don't belong here.

rooms.name: Secret Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel is propped up with timber, and it looks well maintained.  You can see a wooden panel at the far western end of this tunnel.

West.description: There is a wooden panel in this direction.

rooms.name: T-Junction
rooms.description: You have reached a T-junction.  The tunnel continues northward and a well used path leads to the west.

rooms.name: Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel leads upwards and northward.  However, you have a feeling of foreboding and doom here, as if you don't belong here.

rooms.name: Dark Chamber
rooms.description: You exit into a dark and dank chamber.  You aren't sure how far down you have gone but it must have been really deep.  You can't even see the roof of this chamber.  A tunnel leads to the north.

rooms.name: Crawlway
rooms.description: This crawlway is very small.  You are barely able to squeeze through it. It slopes downward towards the darkness.  Some sort of slippery moss is growing on the walls, making it near impossible to climb back up.

rooms.name: Bottom of the well
rooms.description: The well is dry, not a drop of water remains but a damp, mossy smell still prevails.  The spikes here are somewhat rusty.  You doubt that it would support your weight on the journey up.  In the dim light, you notice a dark tunnel in the west face of the wall.  It looks man-made.

rooms.name: Dark Passageway
rooms.description: A dimly lit passageway leads towards the east.

Up.description: You can barely make out the outline of something metallic up there.

rooms.name: Amber Room
rooms.description: You enter a room filled with an amber light.  There are murals on the wall, but the light does not permit you to see exactly what it is.  In the eastern wall, there is an amber door.  A keyhole is placed right in its centre.

rooms.name: Turquoise Room
rooms.description: This room is similar to the amber room, except that instead of an amber light the room is filled with a greenish light.  A large door dominates the eastern wall.

East.description: The door is made of turquoise and is similar to the amber door. It too gives a jolt to anybody who touches it.

rooms.name: Jet Black Room
rooms.description: This small chamber has no furniture, and only jet black painted walls, ceiling, and floor. The paint or rock or whatever it is reflects light dully, if at all.

East.description: The light from behind the door seems quite bright.  It could be because no other light seems to reflect from the walls.

rooms.name: Portal Room
rooms.description: This room is as black as the previous save the immense silvery glow of the surface of the circular portal against the far wall.  The portal hums slightly...

rooms.name: whacky zzur's mob loading room
rooms.description: GET THE HELL OUT BEFORE ZZUR BEATS YOU.
